name: Managu
description: African nightshade commonly eaten in East Africa.
benefits: Rich in iron, calcium, vitamin A and C.

name: Terere
description: Amaranth leaves widely consumed in traditional diets.
benefits: High in protein, calcium and antioxidants.

name: Mrenda
description: Jute mallow with a slimy texture when cooked.
benefits: Good source of iron and folate; aids digestion.

name: Nduma
description: Arrowroots; a traditional starchy food.
benefits: Gluten-free and high in dietary fiber.

name: Sweet Potato
description: Orange-fleshed sweet potato rich in beta-carotene.
benefits: Improves eye health and provides energy.

name: Sorghum
description: Ancient drought-resistant grain.
benefits: Rich in fiber and iron; gluten-free.

name: Finger Millet (Wimbi)
description: Used for porridge and traditional meals.
benefits: High in calcium and iron; great for bones.

name: Njahi
description: Lablab beans common in Kenyan communities.
benefits: High in protein, iron and dietary fiber.

name: Pumpkin Leaves
description: Commonly cooked with groundnuts or milk.
benefits: Boosts immunity and improves digestion.

name: Baobab Fruit
description: Superfood from the baobab tree.
benefits: Extremely rich in Vitamin C and fiber.

name: Kales (Sukuma Wiki)
description: Widely consumed green leafy vegetable.
benefits: Rich in Vitamin K, A, C, and fiber.

name: Cassava
description: Starchy root used as staple food.
benefits: High in carbohydrates for energy.

name: Cowpeas Leaves (Kunde)
description: Popular leafy vegetable across East Africa.
benefits: Rich in protein, iron, and vitamins.

name: Groundnuts
description: Commonly eaten roasted or in sauces.
benefits: Good source of healthy fats and protein.

name: African Yam Bean
description: Traditional legume high in protein.
benefits: Improves food security and nutrition.

name: Mchicha
description: Wild spinach eaten across East Africa.
benefits: Good source of iron and Vitamin C.

name: Papaya
description: Tropical fruit eaten fresh or in salads.
benefits: Rich in Vitamin C and digestive enzymes.

name: Avocado
description: Nutrient-dense fruit used in salads.
benefits: High in healthy fats and fiber.

name: Pigeon Peas (Mbaazi)
description: Widely used in coastal Kenyan dishes.
benefits: Good protein source; improves soil fertility.

name: Wild Mushrooms
description: Collected seasonally from forests.
benefits: Rich in minerals and low in calories.
